job.job_summary: Workone important aspect of a resume is the verbs you use to describe your work; you want them to indicate the actions you undertook in that job (and ideally match them with the necessary skills for your intended position). For example, instead of "work" (which everyone does at every job), you might say "Coordinate e-commerce for international brands." Or, "Manage projects for diverse team of photographers, etc. etc." with international brands in the Greater Boston area for e-commerce use. Work closely with photographers, fashion coordinators, directors, producers, stylists, makeup artists, other models, and clients to produce the desired looks, and to finish photo shoots on schedule.if you make each of these sentences its own job_summary element, then they will format as a list under the job
Check in customers and assistassist is a good verb to start your summary with with bike set-up Create a warm and welcoming environment for customers

Utilized effective sales skills to raise moneyI would rephrase as "Raised money using effective sales techniques" in the form of donations to USD. Brought in 15 new donors within 3 months. Raised a total of $7215.00 as of December 1st, 2015you might even put this first.

report.p: Overall, I found that your resumé is very appropriate and contains most necessary elements needed in a resumé such as past experience, objective and contact information. The first critique I have of your resumé is your objective. I feel that if you are interested in finding employment in the advertising field then you must demonstrate some sort of background to the field or a greater understanding. In the objective line, “advertising” can be replaced with any other field of work and the objective will still make sense. What I am trying to say is that you should show more expertise by briefly talking about, for example, what in advertising you are most interested in.

I understand why you have listed all your work experiences and roles you’ve done in the past. The intentions for it are supposedly to show your potential employer the array of roles you have taken. However, I feel that there should only be jobs which will help with your intended field of work (advertising in your case). For example, would the potential employer find it helpful to know that you were a receptionist at Turnstyle? Other than these few points, you have produced a solid resumé which includes all necessary elements. Maybe include a picture too?
This is a really good start. Take a look at the comments above, they are mostly to do with how you phrase your job_summary elements, a key aspect of the resume genre. Nice work overall.
